page.title: 01HOCKLEY
page.content: HOCKLEY IS A SMALL TOWN WHICH IS UNDERGOING CHANGE. IT IS ON THE MAIN RAILWAY LINE TO LONDON AND THEREFORE THIS HAS A CONSIDERABLE EFFECT UPON HOUSE PRICES. A HIGH PROPORTION OF THE INHABITANTS COMMUTE TO WORK. IT IS A PLEASANT ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH TO LIVE AND IS ACCESSIBLE TO LARGE LOCAL URBAN CENTRES ASWELL AS PLACES OF EMPLOYMENT. IT HAS UNDERGONE A GREAT DEAL OF DEVELOPMENT OVER THE LAST FEW YEARS AND THIS WILL CONTINUE IN THE NEAR FUTURE. THE AREA IS SERVED BY LOCAL SHOPPING CENTRES AND THE TOWN CENTRE ITSELF, ALTHOUGH THIS IS LIMITED IN THE TYPE OF SHOPS AND OFFICES. A SECONDARY SCHOOL SERVES THE TOWN ITSELF AND THE SMALLER VILLAGES TO THE NORTH AND EAST.
